title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
00:02 <vmassol> has quit  
00:12 <mflorea> has quit  
00:17 <arkub> has quit  
00:35 <bbc581> has quit  
00:46 <bbc581> has joined #xwiki  
00:53 <abusenius> has quit  
01:13 <mar3lis> sdumitriu: i am reading your faq answer about on to many relations, and i have a question  
01:13 <mar3lis> the person class hold the realions right  
01:14 <mar3lis> so you have to create a document of person class for every user that is in some project?  
01:16 <@sdumitriu> Yes  
01:17 <mar3lis> do i have to set the relation only in inline mode or can i do it programmaticly  
01:17 <@sdumitriu> Any way you want  
01:18 <mar3lis> i mean, can i set that a person is on two specific projects programmaticly  
01:18 <@sdumitriu> Yes  
01:19 <mar3lis> for the other way around, having a specific project and wanting to show which users are in that project  
01:19 <mar3lis> do i have to create another relation class?  
01:20 <mar3lis> or can i use the data from personclass objects  
01:34 <mar3lis> sorry  
01:34 <mar3lis> dumb question  
01:34 <mar3lis> did read carefully  
01:39 <@sdumitriu> cjdelisle: Can we delete the 3.1M1 branch>  
01:39 <@sdumitriu> ?  
01:40 <@cjdelisle> It would be nice to have if we have to redo the release but I think we're okay.  
01:40 <@cjdelisle> s/okay/committed/ ;)  
01:40 <@sdumitriu> We can get it out from the tag  
01:40 <@cjdelisle> good point  
01:41 <@cjdelisle> Should we keep the hudson jobs around? It makes sense to me because we're going to need them next release.  
01:42 <@sdumitriu> No  
01:42 <@sdumitriu> We can re-create them, it's an easy step  
01:43 <npm> has quit  
01:46 <@sdumitriu> cjdelisle: I'm deleting them  
01:46 <@cjdelisle> thanks  
01:46 <@cjdelisle> I'm still piecing together history so I can make a presentable wikipedia page  
01:47 <@cjdelisle> Everyone looks at that so it only makes sense  
01:48 <npm> has joined #xwiki  
01:58 <mar3lis> do you guys have some time?  
01:58 <mar3lis> or are you quite busy?  
01:58 <@sdumitriu> Going to sleep  
01:58 <@sdumitriu> Bye  
01:58 <sdumitriu> has quit  
02:08 <lucaa> has quit  
03:10 <ihalip> has quit  
04:02 <qwebirc27> has joined #xwiki  
04:02 <qwebirc27> hi there, I am using psi as a jabber cient  
04:03 <qwebirc27> does anyone know how to join irc channels?  
04:03 <@cjdelisle> using psi for irc channels? I'm not sure  
04:04 <@cjdelisle> Are you sure that psi can do irc?  
04:04 <qwebirc27> I am not sure if I can do it with psi  
04:05 <qwebirc27> I was actually trying to do it with Ichat using jabber service transports configured in psi  
04:05 <qwebirc27> what about the the irc jabber service transports?  
04:06 <@cjdelisle> if you're new to irc I'd recommend chatzilla, it's just a firefox plugin and it will get you running without the need to use someone else's bridge service  
04:06 <qwebirc27> ok  
04:06 <qwebirc27> thanks  
04:07 <qwebirc27> but what if i want to use irc in ichat on a mac?  
04:07 <qwebirc27> I don't use firefox  
04:08 <@cjdelisle> then you need to ask the mac/ichat developers for support because I have never heard of it.  
04:08 <qwebirc27> ok thank u!  
04:08 <qwebirc27> has quit  
04:08 <sburjan\_> has joined #xwiki

09:38 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
09:40 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
09:42 <arkub> has joined #xwiki  
09:44 <vmassol> cjdelisle: good morning. Is it normal that RN for XEM 3.1M1 is missing from http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleaseNotes/ ?  
09:45 <@cjdelisle> Heh, you'd know better than me but my guess is no.  
09:45 <@cjdelisle> Fixing, thanks.  
09:46 <vmassol> (well I didn't know if you had released it or not)  
09:46 <vmassol> cjdelisle: is the release fully over?  
09:47 <@cjdelisle> Everything is released except for the javadoc. I just saved an update to wikipedia which was in dire need of improvement (and still is)  
09:47 <@cjdelisle> Other publications still need attention.  
09:50 <@cjdelisle> http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/XWiki  
09:50 <@cjdelisle> the top of the page is better, the bottom still needs work  
09:55 <vmassol> cjdelisle: cool re wikipedia, needs more updating indeed, just fixed a few things  
09:56 <@cjdelisle> I would like to see a change in the way we interact with publications. I think it is too much work for the release manager to write an announcement everywhere and the quality suffers.  
09:56 <vmassol> well the role of the RM  
09:56 <vmassol> is to only update the versions  
09:56 <vmassol> not more  
09:56 <+sburjan> cjdelisle: I will introduce introduce also Test Report section on the Release Notes page  
09:56 <@cjdelisle> Thanks  
09:57 <+sburjan> IMO we almost should create a template for the ReleaseNotes page for consistency reasons  
09:57 <vmassol> now re content, we don't have any process in place, it's everyone's goodwill right now  
09:57 <@cjdelisle> I would like to introduce the consept of a "go to guy" for each publication.  
09:57 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
09:57 <vmassol> sure, make a proposal  
09:57 <@cjdelisle> I volunteer to do wikipedia.  
10:02 <@sdumitriu> cjdelisle: Very nice article  
10:03 <@cjdelisle> IMO wikipedia is an important publication because every installation starts with an intern doing research on which wiki software to use.  
10:03 <@cjdelisle> We all know where people go to do research  
10:03 <@cjdelisle> If we can do their research for them then we are better off. Best if we can write their presentation for them.  
10:06 <@sdumitriu> Should we mention that after the long 1.0 release, the release frequency went up with around 5 major releases per year?  
10:07 <vmassol> or a relese every 2-3 months  
10:07 <@cjdelisle> I looked at the history page for mediawiki and it was very short so I removed a lot of the history I had been writing.  
10:09 <@cjdelisle> I intend to expand on these things in sections. One thing I was somewhat worried about is not to include too many things about style which, while impressive to a developer may not be impressive to someone who is doing wikiresearch for a presentation.  
10:09 <@cjdelisle> My goal is to make that presentation the easiest thing they ever did :)

11:11 <@cjdelisle> I'm doing the javadoc now, all that's left is wikimatrix which you said you'd do, freshmeat, and "ANN Mail"

12:20 <@sdumitriu> Is it normal for JBoss AS to take several minutes to startup?  
12:20 <vmassol> I think so...  
12:20 <@sdumitriu> It's busy looking inside jars  
12:20 <vmassol> I remember it was taking time before  
12:21 <@sdumitriu> The only jar that's causing problems is jackrabbit-core-1.1-xwiki.jar  
12:21 <@sdumitriu> What's weird is that I don't find any other jar that it's overriding  
12:21 <@sdumitriu> JBoss doesn't include jackrabbit  
12:21 <vmassol> jackrabbit is in tomcat isn't it?  
12:22 <vmassol> you sure?  
12:23 <vmassol> I'm probably wrong  
12:25 <@sdumitriu> I can't find tomcat inside JBoss either...  
12:26 <@cjdelisle> Freshmeat Wikimatrix  ANN Mail   <-- I have no permission to the first 2 and I have no idea what #3 is  
12:27 <abusenius> has quit  
12:27 <vmassol> has quit  
12:28 <@sdumitriu> cjdelisle: ANN Mail you sent already  
12:28 <@sdumitriu> Announcement mail  
12:28 <@sdumitriu> Doing freshmeat and WM  
12:29 <florinciu> has joined #xwiki  
12:29 <@cjdelisle> ahh then that's been done since the exectuables were finished  
12:34 <@sdumitriu> vmassol did WikiMatrix  
12:34 <@sdumitriu> And I posted the FM news  
12:34 <@sdumitriu> So, all done?  
12:34 <@cjdelisle> I just did the French wikipedia.  
12:35 <@cjdelisle> I wonder if the maven site will build. I'll work on that tonight when hudson is not being used.  
12:36 <@cjdelisle> it takes about 4 hours iirc  
12:39 <evalica> has quit  
12:41 <@cjdelisle> I'm going to tke a nap then try to understand why my lock is doing exactly what it is never supposed to.

15:23 <Mondstrahl> has joined #xwiki  
15:24 <Mondstrahl> Hello  
15:24 <Mondstrahl> I try to use XWiki with a new Oracle db  
15:25 <Mondstrahl> I made the changes in WEB-INF/hibernate.cfg.xml  
15:25 <Mondstrahl> But when I try to connect i get:  
15:25 <Mondstrahl> Problem accessing /xwiki/bin/view/Main/. Reason:      Error number 3 in 0: Could not initialize main XWiki context Wrapped Exception: Error number 3001 in 3: Cannot load class com.xpn.xwiki.store.migration.hibernate.XWikiHibernateMigrationManager from param xwiki.store.migration.manager.class Wrapped Exception: Error number 0 in 3: Exception while hibernate execute Wrapped Exception: could not execute query  
15:39 <jbrBridg1> [[[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)] Hi - can I adjust the section levels in the include macro?  
15:39 <jbrBridg1> [[[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)] I want to include a document in one page with headings started at level 2 and in another page with headings startet at level 3.  
15:46 <Mondstrahl> where can i get the latest xwiki.oracle.hbm.xml class for XWiki 3.0 ?  
16:10 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
16:20 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: How should the xeclipse repo be called? xwiki-xeclipse or xeclipse?  
16:21 <vmassol> good question  
16:21 <@sdumitriu> The x in xeclipse already stands for xwiki  
16:21 <vmassol> xwiki-<something> I'd say  
16:21 <vmassol> for consistency  
16:21 <vmassol> maybe xwiki-eclipse  
16:21 <vmassol> since we xe is xwiki-enterprise  
16:22 <vmassol> s/we//  
16:22 <vmassol> xeclipse is the nickname but the full name is Xwiki Eclipse  
16:23 <vmassol> for xwatch it's xwiki watch too, so it would be xwiki-watch  
16:23 <vmassol> wdyt?  
16:23 <@sdumitriu> K  
16:24 <Mondstrahl> Hello everyone. I try to install XWiki with oracle. I made the changes in WEB-INF/hibernate.cfg.xml [15:28] <Mondstrahl> But when I try to connect i get: [15:29] <Mondstrahl> Problem accessing /xwiki/bin/view/Main/. Reason:      Error number 3 in 0: Could not initialize main XWiki context Wrapped Exception: Error number 3001 in 3: Cannot load class com.xpn.xwiki.store.migration.hibernate.XWikiHibernateMigrationManager from param xw  
16:25 <Mondstrahl> where can i get the latest xwiki.oracle.hbm.xml class for XWiki 3.0 ? They seem to be missing in the distributions (zip /war)  
16:27 <@sdumitriu> Mondstrahl: It should be packed inside the xwiki-core-3.1.jar archive  
16:27 <@sdumitriu> But the error should not be in there  
16:27 <Mondstrahl> Hmm  
16:27 <Mondstrahl> ok. I have one instance (old xwiki 1.8) running @ oracle  
16:28 <venkatesh> has quit  
16:28 <Mondstrahl> but i don't get a new test xwiki running  
16:28 <@sdumitriu> I'd say the problem is in the DB connection configuration  
16:28 <Mondstrahl> i'd like to update to xwiki 3.0  
16:28 <@sdumitriu> Did you edit hibernate.cfg.xml?  
16:28 <Mondstrahl> yes  
16:28 <@sdumitriu> Did you put the connector jar in WEB-INF/lib?  
16:29 <Mondstrahl> i created the new testuser and gave him all grants  
16:29 <@sdumitriu> Then you should look for the root error in the server logs  
16:30 <Mondstrahl> I took xwiki-enterprise-jetty-hsqldb-3.0.zip  and changed the hibernate.cfg.xml  
16:30 <Mondstrahl> yes i put the ojdbc14.jar into the lib folder  
16:30 <Mondstrahl> \webapps\xwiki\WEB-INF\lib  
16:32 <Mondstrahl> 2011\_05\_04.request.log ?  
16:33 <mar3lis> has quit  
16:33 <Mondstrahl> sdumitriu: Is the log called something like 2011\_05\_04.request.log ? Where can i find the log you are talking ybout ?  
16:34 <@sdumitriu> Nope, that shows the requests made  
16:34 <@sdumitriu> What container are you using? Tomcat?  
16:34 <@sdumitriu> Or the default Jetty bundled in the zip?  
16:35 <Mondstrahl> Jetty ?  
16:35 <@sdumitriu> OK, then the logs should be printed on the command line  
16:35 <@sdumitriu> Did a cmd window open when you started the server?  
16:35 <Mondstrahl> Yes, and are they stored in a file?  
16:35 <Mondstrahl> Yes the console is there  
16:35 <@sdumitriu> No, just printed for the moment  
16:35 <@sdumitriu> (we just disabled the file logs in 3.0)  
16:36 <Mondstrahl> the buffer of the console window seems to be to small for all the log text  
16:36 <Mondstrahl> oh, ok  
16:37 <Mondstrahl> First i get Started [[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection):8080  
16:37 <Mondstrahl> But the errors start when i try to connect to it  
16:37 <@sdumitriu> Yes  
16:38 <@sdumitriu> You should be able to increase the scroll buffer by editing the window properties  
16:38 <Mondstrahl> When are the tables created ? The first time i connect ?  
16:38 <@sdumitriu> Yes  
16:41 <Mondstrahl> I changed buffer to 999 but is not enough.  
16:47 <Mondstrahl> in the hibernate.cfg.xml we config     <mapping resource="xwiki.oracle.hbm.xml"/>     <mapping resource="feeds.oracle.hbm.xml"/>     <mapping resource="activitystream.hbm.xml"/> But these are not present in the folders...  
16:48 <@sdumitriu> They should be inside the xwiki-core-3.0,jar  
17:09 <Mondstrahl> sdumitriu: I could only find xwiki-enterprise-installer-generic-3.0-standard.jar. Can you provide the link, please?  
17:09 <@sdumitriu> webapps\xwiki\WEB-INF\lib\xwiki-core-3.0.jar  
17:10 <Mondstrahl> thank you  
17:11 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: Should I add xoffice and xeclipse as submodules to trunks?  
17:11 <@sdumitriu> They're not part of the usual workspace  
17:11 <@sdumitriu> So I'd say no  
17:11 <vmassol> sdumitriu: personally I don't think we should have trunks  
17:11 <@sdumitriu> It's a simple way to checkout the usual repos  
17:11 <vmassol> it really depends on what people want to work on  
17:11 <vmassol> and it's bit of a pain to update the submodules  
17:11 <vmassol> you need to remember the command line...  
17:11 <@sdumitriu> The problem is that it uses read-write submodules, so it's useless for contributors/users  
17:11 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: It's simple, "git sup"  
17:12 <@sdumitriu> ...Once you've set up the alias  
17:12 <vmassol> you have an alias?  
17:12 <vmassol> yes  
17:12 <vmassol> still I don't really see the need  
17:12 <vmassol> the pros are small  
17:12 <@sdumitriu> Well, it's not mandatory to use it  
17:12 <vmassol> anyway if we want to keep it then it should be called xwiki-enterprise-trunks I guess or xwiki-manager-trunks  
17:12 <@sdumitriu> Unless you think it's doing more harm, I'd like to keep it  
17:13 <@sdumitriu> Or even developer-trunks or committer-trunks since it only works for developers  
17:13 <vmassol> I'm not sure yet if it does more harm or not, it can certainly confuse users a bit. It's fine to keep them if you think they're useful  
17:14 <vmassol> I don't think devs would really need/use them, it's more for contributors I'd say  
17:14 <@sdumitriu> I do  
17:14 <vmassol> also it seems to require maintenance, I see regular updates from you about htem  
17:14 <@sdumitriu> The problem is that the commands to use it are not that easy to know and remember at the moment  
17:15 <@sdumitriu> Yes, so I was thinking that we should only commit releases  
17:16 <@sdumitriu> Or have a hook that automatically updates when a commit on one of the submodule's master happens  
17:16 <vmassol> I don't know enough about gitmodules to give an opinion on this :)  
17:16 <@sdumitriu> I'd rather keep it for tags only  
17:16 <vmassol> if you were to spend some time on hooks I'd like the email diff one ;)  
17:16 <@sdumitriu> Me too  
17:17 <Chami> has joined #xwiki

17:45 <Mondstrahl> But i have configurated the hibernate.cfg.xml  
17:45 <Mondstrahl> and my user is xwikitest  
17:46 <Mondstrahl> Is there some other file i have to set up  
17:46 <Mondstrahl> ?  
17:49 <asyd> can you paste your hibernate.cfg.xml ?  
17:49 <asyd> and btw, having french locales on a server is a bad thing :P  
17:49 <Mondstrahl> <?xml version='1.0' encoding='utf-8'?> <!DOCTYPE hibernate-configuration PUBLIC "-//Hibernate/Hibernate Configuration DTD//EN"   "http://hibernate.sourceforge.net/hibernate-configuration-3.0.dtd"> <hibernate-configuration>   <session-factory>      <!-- Please refer to the installation guide on          http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Installation for configuring your          database. You'll need to do 2 things  
17:49 <Mondstrahl> hmm  
17:50 <Mondstrahl> <property name="connection.username">wikitest</property>  
17:50 <Mondstrahl> <property name="connection.password">wikitest</property>  
17:50 <Mondstrahl> i deleted the other configs for the other databases  
17:50 <arkub> has joined #xwiki  
17:51 <Mondstrahl> its here: http://pastebin.com/p0T7fwS9  
17:53 <Mondstrahl> asyd: have you seen it ?

19:25 <mar3lis> it worked fine
